item.title: EP 85 - Do Nuclear Bombs Really Exist?
item.itunes:title: Do Nuclear Bombs Really Exist?
item.description:
Today we view the paranormal through the eyes of a child, get spooked out by eerie red lights, and then try not to get blown up while we discuss whether or not nuclear bombs exist.

Patreon
https://www.patreon.com/user?u=18482113

MERCH STORE!!!
https://tinyurl.com/y8zam4o2

My brother and nephew Jace have a close encounter and we all remember what it was like to be a child when exploring the new world of the paranormal.

Then we investigate two reports of "red lights." Are these creepy stories real or just the beginning of a new creepypasta?

And then we take a look at the idea that nuclear bombs don't exist. Is the footage we've all seen faked? Is it possible to pack that much power into one bomb?

Links:

Red Light Incident March 2018

http://archive.4plebs.org/x/thread/20497356/

Red Light Incident April 2018

http://archive.4plebs.org/x/thread/20568394/#20570182

Conspiracy theorist reveals why we shouldn't worry about NUCLEAR war

https://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/weird-news/608287/world-war-3-nuclear-north-korea-us-kim-jong-un-donald-trump-conspiracy-bombs-fake-video

The atomic bomb hoax 1945-2018

http://heiwaco.tripod.com/bomb.htm

Nukelies.com

https://big-lies.org/nuke-lies/www.nukelies.com/forum/index.html

The Nuclear Hoax: Some Reasons Why I Don't Believe Nuclear Weapons Exist

https://steemit.com/nuclear/@not-the-bomb/the-nuclear-hoax-some-reasons-why-i-don-t-believe-nuclear-weapons-exist

Joe Rogan & Eddie Bravo Argue Over Nuclear Bomb Conspiracy

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wMducuXJeKg

Listen to the daily podcast anywhere you listen to podcasts!

------------------------------------------------

Logo Art By Ash Black
Opening Song: "Atlantis Attacks"
Closing Song: "Bella Royale"
Music By Dr. Huxxxtable
Hood River

http://www.DeadRabbit.com

Email: DeadRabbitRadio@gmail.com

Twitter: @DeadRabbitRadio

Facebook: www.Facebook.com/DeadRabbitRadio

Paranormal, Conspiracy, and True Crime news as it happens! Jason Carpenter breaks the stories they'll be talking about tomorrow, assuming the world doesn't end today.
